content: @Murat Akbal on the publisher side, have you had a chance to try out the testing tools from the MITRE team? If not, that would be a great first step. https://infernotest.healthit.gov/community/ will let you provide a $bulk-publish endpoint for SMART Schedulink Links testing.
And on the consumer side, would be great to get a sense of your goals and testing plans.

I ran the Inferno tests against the publisher endpoint the weekend, and the tests highlighted a couple of (what I'd describe as) 'encoding/structural' issues with the json files being sent back @Murat Akbal, which are hopefully easy to fix. I think there were a number of other errors/warnings that probably fall into 'data completeness' category, which is a bit more fuzzy from a requirements perspective, and I'd like to refine how our tests deal with those this week depending on what the group thinks is important/reasonable. Let me know if you have trouble running those tests or disagree with the results.
